alert.note: Alert for Pima (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 28 at 12:59PM MST until August 28 at 1:45PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Central Arizona, including the following county, Pima. * WHEN...Until 300 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1257 PM MST, gauge reports indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. The green mountain rain gauge has recorded 1.26 inches of rain in the last hour. This will cause small stream flooding. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Chimney Rock Creek, Agua Caliente Wash, Buehman Canyon and San Pedro River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... parts of the Catalina highway from Rose Canyon Lake to Thimble Peak Vista - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
